DOC.HEAD: Bush Signs Bill Requiring Environmental Studies
DOC.TEXT: President Bush on Thursday signed into law a bill prohibiting U.S. support for international lending projects unless their environmental impact is studied first. The purpose of the bill is to force international lending agencies such as the World Bank and the Inter-American Development Bank to consider the potential environmental consequences of development projects in the Third World. ``Multilateral banks should not provide support to projects that destroy the natural resource base of countries we're trying to help,'' said Sen. Frank R. Lautenberg, D-N.J., who added the provision to the National Environmental Policy on International Financing Act of 1989.
